title: Rephrasing in Task 2
content:
Rephrase these sentences to make them sound less dogmatic. Type your answers in the spaces provided.

Example:

DOGMATIC: Women should get higher salaries than men.

REPHRASE WITH: arguments / made / stating

REPHRASED SENTENCE: (9 words) There are arguments to be made for stating that women should get higher salaries than men.

questions.instructions: Type your rephrased sentence in the space provided below.
questions.question:
DOGMATIC: Smokers should not be entitled to medical treatment due to…

REPHRASE WITH: could / argued

REPHRASED SENTENCE: (5 words) __________ smokers should not be entitled to medical treatment due to…
field_answers: it could be argued that|It could be argued that
questions.correct_feedback: Correct! 'It could be argued that' is the right way to make the sentence less dogmatic.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. The correct answer is: 'It could be argued that smokers should not be entitled to medical treatment due to…'
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is: 'It could be argued that' (5 words). This phrase makes the statement less dogmatic by presenting it as one possible argument rather than an absolute fact.

questions.instructions: Type your rephrased sentence in the space provided below.
questions.question:
DOGMATIC: There is no value in teaching the arts in schools because …

REPHRASE WITH: people / believe

REPHRASED SENTENCE: (4 words) __________ there is no value in teaching the arts in schools because …
field_answers: some people believe that|Some people believe that|some people believe|Some people believe
questions.correct_feedback: Correct! 'Some people believe that' is the right way to make the sentence less dogmatic.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. The correct answer is: 'Some people believe that there is no value in teaching the arts in schools because…'
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is: 'Some people believe that' (4 words). This phrase makes the statement less dogmatic by attributing the view to some people rather than stating it as a fact.

questions.instructions: Type your rephrased sentence in the space provided below.
questions.question:
DOGMATIC: The death penalty would reduce crime since…

REPHRASE WITH: school / thought / which / believes

REPHRASED SENTENCE: (9 words) __________ the death penalty would reduce crime since…
field_answers: there is a school of thought which believes|There is a school of thought which believes|there is a school of thought which believes that|There is a school of thought which believes that
questions.correct_feedback: Correct! 'There is a school of thought which believes (that)' is the right way to make the sentence less dogmatic.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. The correct answer is: 'There is a school of thought which believes that the death penalty would reduce crime since…'
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is: 'There is a school of thought which believes that' (9 words). This phrase makes the statement less dogmatic by presenting it as one perspective among many.

questions.instructions: Type your rephrased sentence in the space provided below.
questions.question:
DOGMATIC: It is better to live in a developed country. This is because…

REPHRASE WITH: reasons / suggest

REPHRASED SENTENCE: (5 words) __________ it is better to live in a developed country. This is because…
field_answers: there are reasons to suggest|There are reasons to suggest|there are reasons to suggest that|There are reasons to suggest that
questions.correct_feedback: Correct! 'There are reasons to suggest (that)' is the right way to make the sentence less dogmatic.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. The correct answer is: 'There are reasons to suggest that it is better to live in a developed country. This is because…'
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answer is: 'There are reasons to suggest that' (5 words). This phrase makes the statement less dogmatic by presenting it as a suggestion based on reasoning rather than an absolute truth.
